tweets.text: @EnvAgencyMids The stink is now day and night and unbearable. Surely with you FINALLY checking loads it is time for independent core testing of what has gone into that landfill. Why wasn't it being checked? We need to know - you should act for the public, no one else @StinkStopthe #StopTheStink
@StinkStopthe 7 stench incidents reported by email since Sunday and not one reference number received as yet. Shocking unprofessional set up @EnvAgencyMids

They drain our chalk streams dry, dump over 3.1 million hours worth of sewage into our rivers and now this.

The water industry is the UKs' largest source of micro plastic pollution in rivers.

So much for regulation then. @Defra @Ofwat @EnvAgency 

https://t.co/Sb77dX1RmG

urls.title: Water firms are main source of microplastics in UK rivers, study says
urls.description: Research says discharge of untreated sewage and wastewater during dry spells to blame

tweets.text: The @EnvAgency clearly doesn't have enough funds or boots on the ground to tackle this. Gov't needs to stump up, and polluters should pay. In the meantime, if you see muck pollution, please report it to the EA: 0800 807060. And share your photos. /4
@Pell_Frischmann @ShopChesterLeSt @ICE_NE @esh_group @DurhamCouncil @EnvAgency Well done - it‚Äôs made such a difference too. üëè

More agricultural muck stored against the rules, literally on top of a watercourse this time. Directly under the muck pile runs a drainage ditch that runs straight into the River Frome, which runs straight into the Lugg, which exceeds phosphate limits. @EnvAgency /1 https://t.co/IhAXZqe2gs

@JamesBevanEA @EnvAgency You should be holding your P45 on that photo, completely failed the people of Newcastle under Lyme. Can't decide if you  and Dinnis are totally incompetent  or are taking backhanders.
I dare you to come to Newcastle and smell for yourself.

@EllieChowns @EnvAgency It‚Äôs literally incredible that some are happy to flout environmental legislation (during a widely know phosphate crisis) anticipating that the EA doesn‚Äôt have enough resources to do anything.
